Justin Trudeau was born on December 25, 1971, in Ottawa, Canada, and is the son of former Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trudeau was elected as the leader of the Liberal Party of Canada in 2013 and led the party to victory in the 2015 federal election, becoming Canada's 23rd Prime Minister. During his tenure, he has focused on promoting diversity, inclusion, and reconciliation with Canada's Indigenous peoples. He has also emphasized the importance of diplomacy and peaceful coexistence on the global stage, and has been a vocal advocate for addressing climate change.

Trudeau's leadership has been marked by his energetic personality and his willingness to engage with citizens directly through social media and public appearances. He has been praised for his efforts to promote human rights and social justice, as well as his commitment to promoting Canada's unique cultural contributions.
